Text:
why 2 GB?
Black is really black, no Blocky dark scenes, it's not Blurry either, no pixelation, just as clear as the source DVD(7.7 GB).
I first tried to make it 1.5 GB but was not perfect. cheers.
Thanks - been wanting to see this for a long time!
Nice Quality Rip  V:10  A:10  Thanx :)

http://www.bilderkiste.org/show/original/9129355489277/fail.jpg

Thanks to you all who keep seeding it.

This is a good rip, but I really wonder if there isn't some cropping or other stuff going on with the aspect ratio.
This file has it as a perfect 16:9 which fills up my whole tv-screen without any blackborders. It is the first feature film (of this age, before widescreen-tvs) that I have seen in this format. Also, imdb says it should be 1.85:1 so. . 
I think this release is malformed, although very watchable.
Why the HELL do people use Matroska!
